title: How to Download a Video: 4 Step-by-Step Methods for Any Device

steps.title: Go to 4K Download's website.
steps.content: Go to 4K Download's website. 4K Download has several products, but 4K Video Downloader+ allows you to download videos from most major video-sharing sites, including YouTube, TikTok, Instagram, and more.

steps.title: Click the Download button at the top of the screen.
steps.content: Click the Download button at the top of the screen. This will show you all of 4K Download's products.

steps.title: Click on 4K Video Downloader+.
steps.content: Click on 4K Video Downloader+ . 4K Video Downloader+ is available for Windows, Mac, Linux, and Android.

steps.title: Download the installer that matches your operating system.
steps.content: Download the installer that matches your operating system. Click the Download button next to the installer that matches your OS and click through any popups that appear on the screen asking for permission or where to download the file.

steps.title: Install 4K Video Downloader+.
steps.content: Install 4K Video Downloader+. Run the installer once downloaded to begin the installation process, and follow the on-screen instructions to install the program. You can use 4K Video Downloader+ for free, though you are limited to 30 downloads per day, and there will be ads. 4K Download offers various licenses for 4K Video Downloader+ that range from $15 to $45, which gives you more features, such as unlimited downloads.

steps.title: Copy a video link.
steps.content: Copy a video link. You can copy a video link from YouTube, Twitter, TikTok, Instagram, Vimeo, Dailymotion, or many other popular video sites to download. You can copy the video link (or URL) from the address bar at the top of your browser. If you're on Android, you may need to copy the video link by tapping the Share button first, then selecting Copy link or Copy video link .

steps.title: Open 4K Video Downloader+.
steps.content: Open 4K Video Downloader+. If you have a link in your Clipboard, the Paste Link icon in the upper-left will be active.

steps.title: Click Paste Link.
steps.content: Click Paste Link . 4K Video Downloader+ will open a popup with various options. Select the options you want for your video, or leave it on the automatic settings.

steps.title: Click the Choose button near the bottom of the screen to select a download location.
steps.content: Click the Choose button near the bottom of the screen to select a download location. You can navigate to your Videos folder, Downloads folder, or any other location on your computer where you want to save the video.

steps.title: Click the Download button.
steps.content: Click the Download button. 4K Video Downloader+ will begin downloading your video, showing you a progress bar. You can also download an entire playlist or YouTube channel by copying the playlist or channel link and pasting it into 4K Video Downloader+.

steps.title: Navigate to the location where you saved your video.
steps.content: Navigate to the location where you saved your video. Your video will be there, ready to rewatch or use for the project you need.

steps.title: Go to the Video Downloader Professional extension page.
steps.content: Go to the Video Downloader Professional extension page. You must be using Google Chrome to install this extension . You cannot use this extension to download YouTube videos. Browser extensions are not supported on the mobile versions of the browser.

steps.title: Click Add to Chrome.
steps.content: Click Add to Chrome . If you are using a browser other than Chrome, this button will prompt you to install Chrome instead, unless you are using Opera. Opera can install Chrome extensions from the Chrome Web Store.

steps.title: Click Add Extension.
steps.content: Click Add Extension . This will appear in a small popup and install the extension after a moment. You may need to restart your browser to complete the installation.

steps.title: Go to a page with videos.
steps.content: Go to a page with videos. Video Downloader Professional will automatically detect any videos on the page.

steps.title: Click the Video Downloader Professional icon (green arrow).
steps.content: Click the Video Downloader Professional icon (green arrow). This will be located to the right of the address bar in your browser and will open a menu.

steps.title: Click a video in the list.
steps.content: Click a video in the list. The menu will list all of the downloadable videos on the page. Selecting a video will add it to your download queue. You can view your downloads by pressing Ctrl + J or opening the menu (3 vertical dots) and selecting Downloads .

steps.title: Go to the Video DownloadHelper page in Firefox.
steps.content: Go to the Video DownloadHelper page in Firefox. You can also open the Firefox menu (☰) and click Add-Ons to search for “Video DownloadHelper.”

steps.title: Click Add to Firefox.
steps.content: Click Add to Firefox . A download bar will appear in the upper left corner.

steps.title: Click Add.
steps.content: Click Add . You may be prompted to restart your browser after installing.

steps.title: Go to a page with videos.
steps.content: Go to a page with videos. The addon will detect videos on the page.

steps.title: Click the Video DownloadHelper icon (colored dots).
steps.content: Click the Video DownloadHelper icon (colored dots). This will be in the upper right corner next to the address bar and bring up a menu.

steps.title: Click a video in the list.
steps.content: Click a video in the list. The menu will list all the downloadable videos on the page. Selecting a video will add it to your download queue. You can view your downloads by pressing Ctrl + J or clicking the download icon (down arrow) in the upper right corner.

steps.title: Download or locate a screen recorder.
steps.content: Download or locate a screen recorder. While it's not the same as directly downloading the video, you can use a screen recorder to record your own copy of a video. OBS Studio is a free screen recorder you can use for Windows, Mac, and Linux. Both iPhone and Android have built-in screen recording capability, so you don't need to download any additional apps. steps.title: Navigate to the video you want to save.
steps.content: Navigate to the video you want to save. You can even record streaming services like Netflix with this method.

steps.title: Open OBS, if on a computer.
steps.content: Open OBS, if on a computer. Open up OBS and configure it to record your screen: Under the Scene header, click the plus button to add a scene. You can name it whatever you want. Under Sources click the plus button and select Display Capture . In the popup, select the monitor you want to be your source. If you only have one monitor, you will only have one option, but if you have multiple monitors, you should select the one on which the video will be playing. Ensure you have Desktop Audio turned up so OBS will record the sound from the video. If you have other audio inputs, like from a microphone, you may want to turn those volumes down to avoid interference.

steps.title: Start screen recording.
steps.content: Start screen recording. You should start screen recording before you start the video so you don't miss the first part of the video. On OBS, press Start Recording , and on an iPhone or Android, simply tap the screen recording button and wait for the countdown to complete.

steps.title: Start the video.
steps.content: Start the video. Allow the video to play for as long as you want to record.

steps.title: Stop the screen recording.
steps.content: Stop the screen recording. In OBS, press Stop Recording , and on your iPhone or Android, simply tap the screen recording button again.
